website_summaries.verdict: A diamond in the rough among mid-range fly reels, this lightweight reel is fun to fish with, offering tactile feedback.
pros: Very lightweight overall, with a handy rubber grip that provides better control
Fun to use against fast-moving fish
cons: Spool and frame can be off balance, causing wobbling
Drag mechanism can wear out with heavy use
Retrieve is a little too smooth, with a tendency to reel in loose line at the end of a cast

customer_reviews.title: Peacock Bass Reel
customer_reviews.text: I use the SLV 8/9 mainly for Peacock bass. Peacocks do not peel line generally so you do not require drag. Other fish that I have caught are Himara (wolf fish) and Arowana with this reel. Once had a bad snag that broke the rod and warped the frame. Called Okuma and they sent me a new frame for free including shipping. Because of the price I can afford to have multiple spools so I switch out line according to conditions or fly.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Wang

customer_reviews.title: Five stars.
customer_reviews.text: My wife had lost her fly reel, and we needed to get one for her asap. We were leaving for our annual camping/fly fishing trip in Idaho. These guys were quick and we got it...and she loves it! She has more expensive reels (and of course she found the one she lost, but she kept using the Okuma. It was reliable and the drag was very smooth. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great 2wt reel!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this reel. The Okuma SLV 2/3 paired extremely well with my Woronoco Klassic Glass Custom Rod, which is a true 2 weight rod. The reel's got plenty of room for a WF-2F line and some backing (though backing probably isn't necessary on a 2 weight setup), and there is plenty of room. The adjustable drag system provides a good range of drag as well. I imagine this is a great reel in the larger sizes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Bought expecting it to work for a one-time trip to the salt flats. Quite surprised about the quality of the build, and it lasted the whole trip. I had reservations about using it in saltwater, but it seems to have survived fine. I rinsed it each night with frewsh water and made sure to keep it out of the sand. Didn't have any major reel-burners on, so that may be the defining matter, but for some small Trevalley it worked awesome. I hope you found this review to be helpful, please click below to indicate that you did. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Chuck JTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Its a solid fly reel for someone looking to get into the sport of fly fishing. I've had my for over a year now and have beat the crap out of it, by dropping it and dragging it. it still works amazing well. if you are looking for a affordable work horse, look no further. I highly recommend this reel. have fun reeling them in.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: One of the best values in fly reels. I have been using mine on the surf for perch, and this has held up very well. Just remember, If you will be using it in saltwater, a thin coating of Yamaha Marine Grease on the insides and Boeshield T9 on the outside/spool is a very good preventative measure.
customer_reviews.author: Randy D.

customer_reviews.title: OK reel for the $. Potential issue is the ...
customer_reviews.text: OK reel for the $. Potential issue is the plastic threads on the drag adjustment. I can see one grain of sand getting in there and goofing up the threads. It does have a screw to take out the old and replace the threads but it is rinky dink. I would prefer paying $10 more and have the threads in SS.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great value
customer_reviews.text: I have used fly reels that cost three or more times as much money but have yet to find one that performs any better than this reel does. Considering the difference in cost, I can't imagine why anyone would want to pay more. The spare spool has the next sized line to zip right on my reel when I want to change rods. Spools and reels are a great value. I'm going to get another one to store with my pack rod to have with me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: plotthunter

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME REELS
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these reels and use them all in salt water ( 5/6 - 6/7- 8/9 - 5/6 ) I run a floating line and a sinking line on my 5/6 reels thats why I have 2 of that weight . have had a couple of these for 3 years and no signs of rust and no problems with them at all . have landed a lot of halibut and bass, corbina, pearch, etc. for the price you will not go wrong at all . just rinse in warm water with every use . love these reels !
customer_reviews.author: d. french

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drag system
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Okuma fan. I got this spare spool to go with my 10/11 wt Okuma SLV reel. I used both at the Cape Lookout Albacore Festival. It held its own against the fasted Albacore on multiple runs of 200 yards and more. Excellent drag system.
customer_reviews.author: BCHvogel

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it - stick with the behemoth
customer_reviews.text: This reel is by far the worst reel I have purchased/used since the trout rod I used as a kid. Absolutely trash reel, have lost faith in Okuma. Was going to return but it's too late so here I am.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Walker

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't fly fished in years, so trying to get back into it without breaking the bank. I know this reel is heavier than some of the higher end models. But fit and finish is very good. Drag seems to work well and is fairly consistent. Bearings are smooth. And I'm not going to blame the reel if I don't catch fish.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I hope they continue this reel
customer_reviews.text: cheap and still have it 6 years later and treat my gear hard. this thing has be dunked covered in mud and sand I have always been able to bring her back. I love it. I hope they continue this reel. My next setup will be another one of these whatever size.
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Has a good feel
customer_reviews.text: I like the appearance on my rod. Perfect size and weight for me. It feels smooth and sturdy. Have not used it enough to evaluate its dependability.
customer_reviews.author: Exercise2day

customer_reviews.title: Great spare spool
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up from Amazon's used warehouse and it came in "like new" condition. The spool fits perfect and we'll balanced. Will be nice to use for backup when carrying two line types.
customer_reviews.author: ACM1057

customer_reviews.title: Solid Reel
customer_reviews.text: Solid reel for the money. Although I'm not entirely sold on the over-sized reels, I guess I'm more of a traditionalist when it comes to reel size. Don't get me wrong, it is a quality light weight reel, with a great drag system and a silent retrieve. I honestly believe you can't find a reel with these features for a better price. Time will tell how it holds up with regular (ab)use.
customer_reviews.author: kzoo1

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I took a fly lesson and used the instructors gear (bottom-line reddington pole and reel), then purchased this reel (and the matching SLV Rod) to practice with. So far, this reel is great. When I got it, I immediately pulled it apart to inspect the quality of the individual parts and construction and can say that this reel is solid. If you're thinking of getting into fly fishing, snap this reel up. Unless you never use it, you won't regret getting it.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: High quality reel!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for ice fishing. Very nice! Very smooth action and quality workmanship. Happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Larsen

customer_reviews.title: not so good
customer_reviews.text: Gets wet and locks up. Replaced with a sealed drag reel after one use....
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: fantastic reel
customer_reviews.text: very nice reel, practically no noise, good drag, good size and well made. good value for money
customer_reviews.author: MR C M Montanez

customer_reviews.title: Great Value in fly reels
customer_reviews.text: I have been fly fishing for 48 years. This reel is the best value in a reel that I have never owed. Smooth operation steady drag. The great bonus is its looks. When I buy equipment I look for value and function. This reel has both in spades. This is great light trout reel. I can wait to try out his big brothers as I have ordered both a 5/6 and a 7/8 for larger trout and steelhead. Okuma keep up the great work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: drag feels pretty nice, but the metal is soft and dents ...
customer_reviews.text: it seems decent. fills how you would expect, drag feels pretty nice, but the metal is soft and dents easy if you set it down to hard. i'd rather have a cabellas prestige plus fly reel, if im honest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value fly reel with decent drag
customer_reviews.text: This reel has been working great for me over the past few years. I use it for trout fishing, nothing over 8 pounds or so. My only complaint is there is a fair amount of side-to-side slop in the spool, probably due to an imperfect fit between frame axle and spool bushing/bearing - functions well, so no big deal for me considering the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Great little reel for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have many fancier (more expensive) reels, but none that I like better than this one. Well, at least not a lot better. This is a great value for a light weight fly reel. Very smooth drag, the arbor is the perfect size, nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel a couple months ago and have been quite impressed with the overall construction, quality and performance. I've caught dozens of fish on it from 6-inchers to 5 pounders and it's been consistently solid. For the price, I don't think it gets much better...nice job Okuma.
customer_reviews.author: franzelli

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with drag and line capacity
customer_reviews.text: Used the 10/11 down in cabo going after 20-30lb dorado....handled them with no problem. Was able to load 300 yds of dacron on there no problem in case something larger showed up. Impressed with how much drag the reel is capable of for sure. Haven't had out against any larger charging fish (tuna, rooster, marlin) but will be putting it to the test soon. Giving it 4 stars for now until I see it against a rocket run to make sure the drag system doesn't fry.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S Banashek

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking reel!
customer_reviews.text: This reel looks great, however there is a bit of "rubbing" while reeling in with the spool loaded with fly line and backing. Nothing major, but it is not silky smooth. However, this will do for local creek fishing from a kayak. The price was nice!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Murdoch

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this reel. There aren't enough adjectives available. The only downside is the tendency to rewind ( take up line) with your cast. No way is it a deal breaker. A great reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: FunkyC.

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel, can't beat it for the price. This is my second Okama SLV, I bought this 7/8 for bass and steelhead after a great experience with a 4/5 I bought last year. Drag is super smooth and really easy to adjust if you need to ease up or put the brakes on a big fish. Large arbor holds plenty of line and backing for hard charging steelhead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Arhontas

customer_reviews.title: Great real for the price.
customer_reviews.text: using with 6 WF line and 9ft 5x leaders on a 9ft 6wt 4pc Reddington "Pursuit" rod - I like it WAY more than the reel that came with the combo. Decent take-up, strips quietly, drag works fine. The only awkward feeling in the reel for me lies in the SUPER smooth action reeling in the line - there's ZERO drag. Price is fair. I'm an intermediate angler.
customer_reviews.author: split484

customer_reviews.title: Great reel, one unmentioned quirk.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel, and the drag feels very good. I haven't had a chance to test it on a fish yet though. Definitely worth the low price. One quirk about the reel is that the retrieve is so smooth that it tends to reel in loose line on the stop at the end of a forward cast, which will get annoying when you're trying to cast streamers.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel for a new TFO 9wt rod for a bonefishing trip to Belize. Hands down for the price it is the best fly-fishing reel I have ever owned. Very light, nice and sturdy, adequate line capacity. The drag was smooth enough to tolerate a couple of long runs from hooked bonefish. So far it's held up to the saltwater nicely. Next will be testing it against New England stripers. I will certainly be buying another one of these Okuma reels in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MD New England

customer_reviews.title: Easily Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Used this reel for two days salmon fishing. On the first day, the reel slipped from 2 feet off the ground and was terribly dented. It had to be bent back to almost its original form to be used. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kane

customer_reviews.title: Very nice light weight reel.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't fished with it yet as the snow has not melted, nor has the ice gone out, so I cannot comment on how it will do in the field. But, the quality appears first rate and the reel spins smoothly. Drag is easy to adjust and holds it's setting. Great reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Bought two.
customer_reviews.text: The Okuma SLV reels are outstanding. I've purchase this one (4/5) and was so pleased with its smooth operation, overall quality, and good price that I immediately purchased the (7/8) for my heavier steelhead rod. I'm a lefty, so I needed to switch the retrieve on each reel. No problem. Instructions for doing so are provided and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: DRD

customer_reviews.title: Okuma SLV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Okuma SLV 7-8 for steelhead fishing in Upper Michigan. I landed several nice fish including a couple in the 8-9# class and the reel worked flawlessly. The drag is a bit touch, but other than that it is a tremendous reel at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: How it preforms
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel, works great no mater what line I put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This reel is a super deal!
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth reeling action, smooth drag action, easy clean up. Was bigger than expected but unfortunately I did not hook into any big fish (tarpoon, bonefish) to listen to it screem! Will have to try it on steelhead and stripers soon. Very impressed, esp. with the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Towle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built quality reel. I bought the # 7/8 which holds 100 yards of 20LB braid backing and a # 8 WF line.
customer_reviews.author: Perchy

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel Great Drag
customer_reviews.text: I can definitly recommend this reel. It only makes me wonder why I ever spent two to three times as much for a reel in the past. I have caught a lot fish with this reel in different model sizes over the last three years and have nothing but praise for a well made dependable reel like the SLV. You should buy one, end of story.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: excellent reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these in various sizes and they work great. Nice is that extra spools are available online cheap, makes managing multiple lines easy without breaking the bank. Amazon is also 20 dollars cheaper then various sports outfitters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CANT BE BEAT.
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY FINICKY about my fly fishing equipment so i was a bit skeptical about getting this reel (and matching rod) for my birthday. Simply put,you will not find this much reel for this price anywhere else,and the spools are easily afordable as well. SUPER quality, LIGHTWEIGHT, and SMOOTH as silk.
customer_reviews.author: R. Eaves

customer_reviews.title: Great reels.  Support Taiwan.
customer_reviews.text: Have not fished them yet. Bought a 7/8. And an 8/9. From what I know about quality these reels look and feel great. I'm sure the fish won't care. Highly recommended. Going to order a 4/5 tomorrow. This price is to good to pass up. By the way, switching them to left handed was 2 minutes tops. A snap!!!
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the reel is exceptional. I have caught nearly every inshore species in Florida with this 8 wt reel and performs very well. My favorite feature is the round dial for the drag, as compared to other reels who typically use a star or similar knob design (easier to adjust for me). My only opposition is the composition of the reel, but you get what you pay for. Being cast aluminum it is very light, and will not rust, but is also prone to breaking and bending as opposed to other more expensive reels.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mazza

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart first time fishing
customer_reviews.text: Reel fell apart first use fishing for salmon. Screws that hold reel seat to the frame ripped right off the thread. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Stundzia

customer_reviews.title: Best Reel For the Money!
customer_reviews.text: The Okuma SLV is a excellent reel. It is light, fluid, and versatile. The drag adjustment was a little odd and could use a bit more refining. The instructions for changing the reel to left-handed were simple and only took a few minutes. Some people prefer just to flip the reel around; I'm not one of them. If you're left-handed and want and great reel, search no further.
customer_reviews.author: R. Saldivar

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I got my 8-9 weight reel and it comfortably fits my 8 weight line with 150 yards of 50 lb power pro backing. Very smooth and quiet retrieve with more than enough drag for everything but the biggest saltwater fish. Looks amazing against the red power pro backing.
customer_reviews.author: A. kulha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Reel and nice drag system
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this reel. The drag system is easy to use and seems to be rather effective. I'll really put it to the test when I go Steelhead fishing in mid Oct. I put this reel on an Okuma Crisium Graphite rod and it works great. Looks pretty cool too. No complaints. So far I've caught Largemouth Bass with it. Looking forward to some Steelheads though.
customer_reviews.author: VAFlyFisherman

customer_reviews.title: hands down would get this reel again. Wait, ...
customer_reviews.text: hands down would get this reel again. Wait, I did. I use this for salmon fishing in Alaska and it definitely doesn't have trouble against reds and silvers.
customer_reviews.author: sammy toguchi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love the Okuma SLV reel and an extra spool for $30 is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Fly

customer_reviews.title: Great reel.
customer_reviews.text: Just got my new fly reel today. Very good quality for money. I plan on buying some extra spools for my other lines. The drag is very smooth and something you would find on higher dollar reels. I bought a 5/6 wt and fish mostly for trout. I would recommend if your in the market for a new ree/
customer_reviews.author: Brian Savoy

customer_reviews.title: Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: Not as described. It is just the spook. Not the whole reel.
customer_reviews.author: John George

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended (2-3 wt)
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2/3 for my 7' 4wt Orvis Clearwater and it is Better than my orvis reel.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: I put this on a Shakespeare Ugly Stik and used ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a Shakespeare Ugly Stik and used it for sockeye fishing in Alaska. It worked flawlessly! Did not need to spend big bucks to get an outstanding reel.
customer_reviews.author: m miller

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This reel was a gift for my grandson who is learning to fly fish. A great reel for the price and the kid has landed a few trout already. He loves the reel.
customer_reviews.author: Dthatch

customer_reviews.title: I love this reel!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you can't beat this reel. Very smooth action, great drag system, and lightweight. Plan on getting another for heavier weight as well. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel
customer_reviews.text: Nice reel. I put it on my Redington CT 5wt. Haven't really used the drag yet. Basically just holds my line, but reel feels solid. I would buy it again for my other rods. I have recommended it to my friends. The price is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: NVDarkfrog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great reel, good drag, smooth action. Works well at catching fish.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Isenhart

customer_reviews.title: This is a well-built and effective fly reel. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built and effective fly reel. The price was right (less than $50) and fit my rod well. It's quite strong and I expect it to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: The handsome cook

customer_reviews.title: For the price point it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel. For the price point it can't be beat. Yes, there are better reels out there but if you're looking to not break the bank, I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Really good economy spool
customer_reviews.text: Really good economy reel and the spool is no different. Although its diecast it is still light enough makes it easy to switch reels on the water.
customer_reviews.author: RSisler

customer_reviews.title: nice reel
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fly fishing expert, but this seems to be a really well made, nice looking reel for the price. I haven't caught anything big enough to worry about the drag yet, but for the price I'd buy this reel again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen D.

customer_reviews.title: Okuma SLV 8/9 Fly Reel
customer_reviews.text: Great all around reel for big fish! Smooth drag and easy L/R retrieve switching. Very few open parts so this reel should be great for winter steelhead fishing and not freeze up...
customer_reviews.author: Argoten2

customer_reviews.title: Very nice real, handles nicely
customer_reviews.text: Very nice real,handles nicely. I put it on a 5-6 Eagle claw n it handls nicely with #6 fly line.
customer_reviews.author: stan wojciechowski

customer_reviews.title: No reason to get anything else
customer_reviews.text: I'm a budget-minded fly angler, I admit. But there's seriously no reason to use anything but these Okuma SLV reels. I have a large arbor reel for steelhead and largemouth, and a smaller one for panfish and trout. Both are superb. . . . Only reason I don't give it 4 stars is the drag system is not as receptive as it is on the super expensive reels [my friend buys the fancy reels]. But drag on a fly reel is, imho, not that important. BUY THIS and save your money for a good rod -- must more important than a reel in trying to hook up on a cold-water fish!
customer_reviews.author: Lana J. Yoho

customer_reviews.title: Ok-Reel
customer_reviews.text: Very good reel for the price. Smooth and good adjustable brake setup. I have other Okuma products and have been very happy with all products from them.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this reel. I haven't ever used a very expensive one, but this on is great. the drag works good and adjusts very easily. I have no idea why anyone would not give this reel a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Good reel, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sizes of these... one for a 3 weight and one for a 5 weight rod. It's a very good reel, very pleased with the quality and at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: I believe the SLV may be about the best bargain on the fly reel market
customer_reviews.text: I've used these reels exclusively for winter steelhead fishing whether swinging streamers or drifting nymphs for about 5 years (I currently own 3 of them). I believe the SLV may be about the best bargain on the fly reel market. Definitely affordable and the reels seem to perform well to date. I've hauled in some nice steelhead with them, even in freezing temps (as long as I keep the reel dry).
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As good a fly reel as you will ever need . Anything more is just showing off.
customer_reviews.author: sillyocis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good deal
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a vintage glass 7wt rod. Spooled it with rio 7wt and caught a medium sized steelhead that weekend. The drag was only slightly pulled by the fish but I could tell it would handle if the fish took off. Pretty good deal. I'm a novice fisherman. I hope to catch mor with this setup. Will be good for bass and carp I think Remember the fish done care what rod and reel you have hahahaha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: For son. Very pleased with this reel. New fly rod and needed New reel. Old one kept sticking. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Zia

customer_reviews.title: pretty nice smooth action but tolerances could be better as ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty nice smooth action but tolerances could be better as when stripping out line once the line got caught in a gap between spool crossbars,
customer_reviews.author: rich r

customer_reviews.title: SLV Delight!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this reel for my first attempt at fly fishing. The construction is excellent and the drag is nice and smooth. Mated this to an Okuma Crisium 2-piece fly rod and hit the water for some Browns and Rainbow.
customer_reviews.author: Jooky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good reel, and solid design. I wish I could blame it for my lack of catching fish...
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great reel!!
customer_reviews.text: Great reel for the money. Well made. Beautiful finish. Works better than expected for the reasonable price. Makes me want to buy additional Okuma fishing products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: john  dunkhase

customer_reviews.title: Good for my kind of fishing.
customer_reviews.text: It performs very reliably and the price is good. I suppose a more expensive reel (I mean real expensive) might be able to handle a steelhead or a salmon, but I fish smaller streams in the Sierra's where hooking onto one of those super fish is not going to happen. For my kind of fishing, it makes more sense to buy a high-end fly line.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C

customer_reviews.title: Drag
customer_reviews.text: Very poor drag. Tight or loose not much in between.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for great price
customer_reviews.text: I already have the SLV 56 that I've used for many years. After purchasing another fly rod, I loved it so much that I purchased this one to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this reel for my inexpensive back-up rod. I like it so much that I now use it with my primary rod...replacing a reel that costs 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Sku

customer_reviews.title: Looks tough enough
customer_reviews.text: Needed another fly reel in a hurry and got this pretty quickly. Durable so far, but not much use on it yet. Smooth operation.
customer_reviews.author: N. R. Gawlak

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very solid and a very nice price. Okuma makes a quality product you can't go wrong with.
customer_reviews.author: Insightful Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: You can buy the same reel from Gander Mountain but it will cost you a lot more money. I bought this to use as a salmon reel. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barrett

customer_reviews.title: OKUMA SLV FLY REELS
customer_reviews.text: I own four of these reels for my rods (sizes 3, 5, 7, and 9). Great value. Lightweight, large arbor for quick line retrieval and great drag system.
customer_reviews.author: J JACQUES

customer_reviews.title: For Chironomiding rig
customer_reviews.text: I have the 4/5 and the larger arbor really makes a difference. I got this for a dedicated Chironomiding setup. Great ROI!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: one of the best with the best price
customer_reviews.text: I love this reel its perfect for fishing both trout large and small mouth and crappie you will not beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bearman

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: The spool fits my reel well. I use the reel left-handed and it was fairly easy to switch the spool from right-hand to left-hand wind.
customer_reviews.author: longbow844

customer_reviews.title: Okuma rocks
customer_reviews.text: This reel stands up to the big boys costing 10X more.. My 1st reel is 10yrs old and still going strong.. Like the silver finish and holds up well in the salt..
customer_reviews.author: Sandave

customer_reviews.title: Beware this is just the spool!!
customer_reviews.text: This is just the spool! This is just what i needed
customer_reviews.author: lonnie feller

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for a 5wt
customer_reviews.text: I use this fly reel on my Redington 5wt, it balances well. I really like the Okuma reels and I think they are very well made. Nothing about them feels cheap, the SLV's are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Very good reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got it and I found the reel very sturdy, well built and excellent price/quality . I loaded a 9weight line and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Escobar

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Awsome but came damaged and so did replacement chips in the cast iron
customer_reviews.author: michael belletieri

customer_reviews.title: very good reel
customer_reviews.text: drag system works very well, no more snapped tippet. direction of spool drag can be reversed( right or left handed users )
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT REEL FOR THE MONEY; WORKS JUST AS GOOD AS MY MORE EXPENSIVE REELS.
customer_reviews.author: ALA1  FAYETTEVILLE, NC

customer_reviews.title: Fits an older reel
customer_reviews.text: The one thing that worried me was if it would fit on an older reel. And its all good. Instead of buying a whole new reel, I can swap my reel to a different rod and change the spool with different line on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Nice made reel
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice smooth reel for the money. I do believe they are sized too wrong . Tha is, if you want a four weight with room for a good amount of backing, you had better order a 6 weight, and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Can't see spending more, this reel does it all, nice and light and an amazing price! Smooth drag with a nice smooth bearing that onlt clicks one way but is reveresable.
customer_reviews.author: trouter

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, simply can't be beat. I have more expensive Orvis and Lamson reels and the drag on this sucker is right up there with them. This reel has stopped both lake run steelhead and massive carp. The only downside is that it is not a machined reel, but for the price you wouldn't expect it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Spare Spool (140/20)
customer_reviews.text: I'm resurrecting and upgrading my fly fishing gear. I bought this 'used' SLV 5/6 spool for almost nothing. It is an excellent addition to my tackle. Why? It gives me flexiblity and the ability to make a quick line change when I need it. Akuma SLV equipment is excellent. Akuma gear seldom shows up on Amazon as 'used' because it is very well built, durable, and easy on the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: J. BENNER

customer_reviews.title: awsome
customer_reviews.text: This was a great reel for the money i have used it for over a year and dropped it in water 4 times and it has worked perfectly and has stayed clean, i would buy this reel again for ever.
customer_reviews.author: amy hamby

product_meta.title: Okuma SLV Diecast Aluminum Fly Reel
product_meta.description:
SLV SERIES FLY REELS
Okuma prides itself on delivering high-quality tackle to all types of anglers. With a large arbor spool design for blazing fast line retrieval, SLV reels keep pace with the fastest species in water. Features include a die cast aluminum frame, precision machined stainless steel spool shaft, one-way roller bearing and multi-disc cork, and stainless steel drag system. With a total commitment to advancing the quality of your fishing experience, the SLV selection begins with a 2/3 model and continues through 10/11. A variety of spare spools allow you to outfit your efforts with a selection of line types.

AT A GLANCE
 * Multi-disk cork and stainless steel drag washers
 * Roller bearing allows the drag to engage in one direction only
 * Precision machined brass bushing drive system
 * Precision machined stainless steel spool shaft
 * ALC: alumilite diecast aluminum frame
 * Diecast super large arbor spool design
 * Non-slip positive grip rubberized handle knobs
 * Easy to change left to right hand retrieval conversion
feature_bullets: Okuma slv Super large arbor fly reel 1 RB 7/8 wt 12/145
Multi-Disk Cork and Stainless Drag Washers
Roller Bearing Engages Drag in One Direction
Precision Machined Brass Bushing Drive System
Precision Machined Stainless Steel Spool Shafts
Diecast Aluminum Super Large Arbor Spool Design
